page.title: 14SCHOOL LIFE IN THE THIRTIES
page.content: I remember long walks to school,big fires & huge fireguards,paraffin lamps outdoor middens,smells of smoke & disinfectant,standing around in a vest waiting for the doctor,sitting in the dentists chair,rows of desks with lift _up seats & tops,country_dancing to piano music,the three Rs,knitting & raffia,a stroke of the cane for not knowing a history date.Then there was hot cocoa made by Miss Barwells house_ keeper,no school dinners,touch & ring games,colourful shuttlecocks & bats during Lent or tops for the boys,stoop ball,rounders & races,wearing a sprig of oak on May 29th,trudging through the deep snow during bad winters.In many ways they were hard days but they were happy days AND _ MOST IMPORTANT _ GOOD FRIENDS WERE MADE FOR LIFE!
